page.title: 08Land Use(Cont.)/Livestock
page.content:

Some farmers in the Kinross area depend on{dairy cattle,}others on beef or sheep.The beef cattle are bought at markets(mainly Perth and Stirling) when quite young.The cattle are then fattened until they are about two years old.Depending on size,the farmer may either send the cattle to the slaughterhouse or sell them to a private dealer.The farmer may sell up to fourteen cattle at any one time.The average lvestock numbers on farms in this area range from about 40-80 cattle.Dairy herds may number from 60-100.{Other livestock}on farms in this area are ewes,ram,lambs(for fattening)and hens.Very little beef cattle breeding is done in this area.
